bestBHT.bht: After the miraculous feeding of the five thousand, there was an abundance of broken pieces of food left over. This surplus was not wasted but collected in twelve baskets, indicating completeness and the provision of God. This image is reminiscent of another story (Matthew 16:13-20; Mark 8:27-30), where the baskets symbolize the diversity and abundance that come from a community united in Christ. Ultimately, this verse highlights the sufficiency of God's provision and teaches us that everyone can have a part and be satisfied in Him.

Marvin Vincent: And there was taken up that which remained over to them, of broken pieces, twelve baskets.
Archibald T. Robertson: Twelve baskets (κοφινο δωδεκα). For discussion of κοφονο and σφυριδες as well as of κλασματα (broken pieces) see on Mark 6:43; Matthew 14:20.
John Gill: Every one had a part, and enough.
There was taken up of fragments that remained to them, twelve baskets.

bhtAttempts.bht: After the miraculous feeding of the five thousand, there was an abundance of broken pieces of food left over. This surplus was not wasted but collected in twelve baskets, indicating completeness and the provision of God. This image is reminiscent of another story (Matthew 16:13-20; Mark 8:27-30), where the baskets symbolize the diversity and abundance that come from a community united in Christ. Ultimately, this verse highlights the sufficiency of God's provision and teaches us that everyone can have a part and be satisfied in Him.

After the miraculous feeding of the five thousand, the abundance of broken pieces of food left over was not wasted but collected in twelve baskets, reflecting the completeness and provision of God. This symbolism of the baskets reminds us of another story where they represent the diversity and abundance that result from a united community in Christ. Ultimately, Luke 9:17 emphasizes the sufficiency of God's provision and teaches us that everyone can have a satisfying part in Him.

After the miraculous feeding, the remaining broken fragments of food were gathered in twelve baskets, signifying completeness and God's provision. This echoes the symbolism found in another story, where the baskets represent the abundance resulting from a united community in Christ. Luke 9:17 emphasizes that God's provision is more than enough, and it teaches us that all individuals can partake and be satisfied in Him.

The abundance of broken food was gathered in twelve baskets, symbolizing completeness and God's provision. This imagery is reminiscent of another story, where the baskets represent the diversity and abundance derived from a community united in Christ. Luke 9:17 reminds us of God's ample provision and teaches that everyone can have a satisfying part in Him.

After the miraculous feeding, the surplus broken fragments of food were collected in twelve baskets, signifying completeness and divine provision. This echoes the symbolism in another account, where the baskets represent the abundance resulting from a united community in Christ. Luke 9:17 emphasizes the sufficiency of God's provision and teaches that every individual can have a satisfying part and be fulfilled in Him.
